may be expressly set forth by specific reference in such filing or document.</span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div><span><br/></span></div><div FORMA (EXCLUDING RUSSIA AND UKRAINE FOR ENTIRE 2022) ADJUSTED DILUTED EPS OF $5.35 TO $5.46,</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">NEW YORK, April 21, 2022 &#8211; Philip Morris International Inc. (NYSE&#58; PM) today announces its 2022 first-quarter results. Growth rates presented in this press release on an organic basis reflect currency-neutral adjusted results, excluding acquisitions. Given the uncertainty and volatility regarding the company&#8217;s operations in Russia and Ukraine, PMI is also providing figures and comparisons on a pro forma basis, which exclude the company&#8217;s operations in these two markets for all periods and provide a more comparable view of PMI's business performance. A glossary of key terms, definitions and explanatory notes is included at the end of this press release. Adjustments, other calculations and reconciliations to the most directly comparable U.S. GAAP measures are included in the schedules to this press release.</font></div><div colspan="18" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">(a) On an organic basis<br>(b) Excluding currency</font></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td></tr></table></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Net revenues from smoke-free products accounted for 31.2% of total net revenues, or 30.4% on a pro forma basis</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Market share for heated tobacco units in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> markets, excluding the U.S., up by 1.1 points to 7.5% on a pro forma basis</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Pro forma total </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> users at quarter-end estimated at approximately 17.9 million (up by more than one million versus December 31, 2021), of which 12.7 million had switched to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and stopped smoking. As of year-end 2021, total </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> users in Russia and Ukraine were estimated at approximately 4.8 million</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Declared regular quarterly dividend of $1.25 per common share, representing an annualized rate of $5.00</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Repurchased approximately 2.0 million shares of common stock for $199 million, at an average price of $100.95 per share, representing total repurchases of approximately $1 billion since the start of the current three-year program in July 2021</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">On March 11, 2022, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) authorized the marketing of the </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS 3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> tobacco heating system as a Modified Risk Tobacco Product</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_13"></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;The recent months have been an extremely challenging time for many in the PMI family given the war in Ukraine,&#34; </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">said Jacek Olczak, Chief Executive Officer</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">. &#34;Our primary concern is for our people and their families, and we are doing everything in our power to help them.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;Despite this tragic situation, we were able to deliver a very strong performance in the first quarter -- reflecting the hard work and dedication of our employees globally -- with organic net revenue and currency-neutral adjusted diluted EPS growth coming ahead of our expectations.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;The re-acceleration of our IQOS business continued in the quarter, highlighted by a sequential increase of over one million total IQOS users, excluding Russia and Ukraine, and the superb performance of ILUMA in initial launch markets. This was complemented by the robust performance of our combustible business, which exceeded our objective of stable category share in the quarter and delivered positive shipment volume and organic net revenue growth.&#34;</font></div><div style="margin-top:15pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#34;We expect to deliver robust top- and bottom-line growth this year on a pro forma adjusted basis, including full-year adjusted diluted EPS growth of 9% to 11%, excluding currency. This gives us confidence in achieving our 2021 to 2023 compound annual growth targets, on a pro forma basis, and our ambition to become a majority smoke-free company by 2025.&#34;</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_1615"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">2022 FIRST-QUARTER SUMMARY</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenues increased by 9.0% on an organic basis, reflecting total volume growth driven by the underlying strength of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, the ongoing recovery of the combustible business in many markets against a pandemic-affected comparison, and some positive timing impacts, including inventory movements. The easing of device supply constraints allowed the replenishment of channel inventories, which is expected to continue in the second quarter.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Net revenue per unit increased by 5.3% on an organic basis, driven by the increasing proportion of heated tobacco units in PMI&#8217;s sales mix, higher device sales and higher pricing. Pricing for combustible products increased by over 3%, or by around 6% excluding Indonesia.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income margin declined by 30 basis points on an organic basis, partly reflecting the comparison to a strong prior year margin performance, which benefited from higher productivity mainly due to </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 2 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">timing factors. In addition, adjusted operating margin was impacted by&#58; higher device sales for increasing </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> user acquisition&#59; the growth of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> (with its higher initial unit cost for devices and consumables)&#59; channel replenishment of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> device inventories (noted above for net revenues)&#59; and inflation in certain elements of the company's supply chain -- including energy, wages and direct materials, and an increase in the use of air freight -- which was also exacerbated by the impact of the war in Ukraine.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Despite the margin pressures -- some of which are expected to be temporary -- the company&#8217;s strong net revenue growth, coupled with the positive effects from the increasing size of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, higher pricing, and cost efficiencies, drove adjusted diluted EPS of $1.56 and pro forma adjusted diluted EPS of $1.46, reflecting currency-neutral growth of 14.0% and 16.0%, respectively, as outlined in the table below.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:center"><table $5.39 to $5.50, at prevailing exchange rates, versus reported diluted EPS of $5.83 in 2021. Excluding (i) charges related to the war in Ukraine of $0.03 per share, (ii) a fair value adjustment for equity security investments of $0.03 per share, (iii) adjusted diluted EPS attributable to Russia and Ukraine of $0.10 per share in the first quarter, and (iv) an adverse pro forma currency impact, at </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div to 11% versus pro forma adjusted diluted EPS of $5.48 in 2021, as outlined in the above table.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font replenishment of channel inventories for user acquisition and supply for the accelerated device replacement cycle driven by </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">ILUMA</font><font innovations&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">higher logistics costs, including costs related to the use of air freight to support&#58; (i) the strong up-take of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> consumables in Japan, and (ii) the re-sourcing of select cigarette brands for Japan due to the war in Ukraine&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">investments to grow production capacity across PMI's smoke-free platforms&#59; and</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 4 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">increased inflation in raw material and energy prices, and additional supply chain costs due to war-related disruptions&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">continued commercial reinvestment to support our growing portfolio of smoke-free alternatives&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Other category net revenues of around $350 million (including smoking cessation products), with an operating loss of around $150 million, primarily due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the amortization of intangibles related to acquisitions&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">investments in research and development&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">expenses related to employee retention programs&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Operating cash flow of around $10 billion at prevailing exchange rates and subject to year-end working capital requirements&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:13.8pt">Capital expenditures of approximately $1.0 billion&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">An effective tax rate, excluding discrete tax events, of 21% to 22%&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">The impact on diluted EPS of first-quarter 2022 share repurchases&#59; the impact of potential further 2022 share repurchases is not included in the forecast&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Pro forma second-quarter adjusted diluted EPS of $1.19 to $1.24, including an unfavorable currency impact of around $0.15 per share, reflecting&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Low single-digit pro forma net revenue growth, on an organic basis, notably including&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">an estimated two percentage point drag due to the delayed timing of shipments to Japan, reflecting a temporary depletion of inventories (primarily due to the re-sourcing of supply chain flows driven by prevailing global disruptions in various materials and logistics services, as well as the effects of the war in Ukraine)&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">the adverse impact of the shift to hyperinflationary accounting in Turkey&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">the reversal of certain first-quarter 2022 timing benefits&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">A further contraction in pro forma adjusted operating income margin, on an organic basis, mainly due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">the adverse margin impact of the timing of shipments to Japan, noted above for second-quarter net revenues&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">the disproportionate impact of higher </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> device volume&#59; and</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#9702;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.46pt">the highest expected quarterly increase in air freight costs for the year.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Factors described in the Forward-Looking and Cautionary Statements section of this release represent continuing risks to these projections.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_1594"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Mid-term Targets and 2025 Majority Smoke-Free Ambition</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's 2022 outlook puts the company firmly on track to deliver, on a pro forma basis, its 2021 to 2023 compound annual growth targets of more than 5% for organic net revenues and more than 9% for currency-neutral adjusted diluted EPS. The company is also on track to deliver around $2 billion in gross cost savings.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's ambition to become a majority smoke-free business by net revenues in 2025 remains intact, underpinned by the company's continued confidence in the rapid pace and long-term opportunity of its transformation.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 5 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_1303"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">War in Ukraine</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Since the onset of the war in Ukraine, PMI's main priority has been the safety and security of its more than 1,300 employees and their families in the country. PMI has taken action to achieve three critical missions&#58; helping to evacuate more than 1,000 people from Ukraine and relocate over 2,700 others from conflict zones to locations in the country away from the heaviest fighting&#59; providing critical aid to employees who cannot leave or who decide to remain in Ukraine&#59; and providing those who have left the country with logistical, medical, financial, and other practical support in neighboring countries. The company is continuing to pay salaries to all its Ukrainian employees and is also providing substantial in-kind support to them and their families. In addition, PMI has already contributed around $10 million in funds and donated essential items across the country, directly to humanitarian organizations and through the company's own employee-led initiative, 'Projects With a Heart'.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On February 25th, PMI announced the temporary suspension of its operations in Ukraine, including at its factory, in Kharkiv. While activities in the east of Ukraine remain the most heavily impacted, the company has seen some resumption of retail activities where safety allows, as it seeks to provide product availability and service to adult consumers, using existing finished goods inventories on hand. The company is also working on future supply from other production centers, although this may involve higher costs. PMI is applying increased security and safety measures for personnel.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In 2021, Ukraine accounted for around 2% of PMI&#8217;s total cigarette and heated tobacco unit shipment volume and under 2% of PMI&#8217;s total net revenues. As of March 31, 2022, PMI's Ukrainian operations have approximately $400 million in total assets.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On March 24th, PMI announced the concrete steps it had taken to suspend planned investments and scale down its manufacturing operations in Russia, following its related announcement on March 9th. This included&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the discontinuation of a number of cigarette products offered in the market (representing approximately one-quarter of the company's domestic cigarette SKUs, including </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Marlboro</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Parliament</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> SKUs) and the reduction of its manufacturing activities accordingly&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the suspension of its marketing activities in the country&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the cancellation of all product launches planned for 2022 in the market, including the launch of its flagship heated tobacco product </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, originally planned for March 2022&#59; and </font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the cancellation of its plans to manufacture </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">TEREA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> heated tobacco units for </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> in Russia (with an eventual annualized capacity of more than 20 billion units) and the related ongoing investment of $150 million.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Further, PMI announced that its Board of Directors and senior executives are working on options to exit the Russian market in an orderly manner, in the context of an increasingly complex and rapidly changing regulatory and operating environment.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI employs more than 3,200 people in Russia and will continue to support its employees there, including paying their salaries, while continuing to fulfil its legal obligations. The company will continue to make decisions with their safety and security as a priority. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In 2021, Russia made up almost 10% of total shipment volumes and around 6% of PMI net revenues. As of March 31, 2022, PMI's Russian operations have approximately $1.4 billion in total assets.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 6 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_1543"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%"> 3 MRTP Authorization</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On March 11th, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) authorized the marketing of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS 3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">, a version of PMI's electrically heated tobacco system, as a Modified Risk Tobacco Product (MRTP). In doing so, the agency concluded that an </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS 3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> exposure modification order is appropriate to promote the public health.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The decision demonstrates that </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS 3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> is a fundamentally different tobacco product and a better choice for adults who would otherwise continue smoking. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS 3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> 2.4 are the only electronic inhalable nicotine alternatives authorized as MRTPs based on reduced exposure.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The FDA authorized the marketing of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS 3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> with the following information&#58; </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">The </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> System heats tobacco but does not burn it.</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">This significantly reduces the production of harmful and potentially harmful chemicals.</font></div><div style="padding-left:36pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Scientific studies have shown that switching completely from conventional cigarettes to the </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> system significantly reduces your body&#8217;s exposure to harmful or potentially harmful chemicals.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The FDA concluded that the available scientific evidence demonstrates that </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS 3</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> is expected to benefit the health of the population as a whole, taking into account both users of tobacco products and persons who do not currently use tobacco products.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI hopes to be able to resume the U.S. supply of its </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> portfolio of authorized products in the first half of 2023.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_19"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">U.S. GAAP Treatment of Turkey as a Highly Inflationary Economy</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Following the categorization of Turkey by the International Practices Task Force of the Center for Audit Quality as a country with a three-year cumulative inflation rate greater than 100%, the country is considered highly inflationary in accordance with U.S. GAAP. Consequently, PMI has begun to account for the operations of its Turkish affiliates as highly inflationary, and treat the U.S. dollar as the functional currency of the affiliates, effective April 1, 2022.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_25"></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Conference Call</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">A conference call, hosted by Jacek Olczak, Chief Executive Officer, and Emmanuel Babeau, Chief Financial Officer, will be webcast at 9&#58;00 a.m., Eastern Time, on April 21, 2022. This will be the final earnings conference call introduced by Nick Rolli, Vice President, Investor Relations &#38; Financial Communications, who will retire at the end of May, following 35 years of dedicated service to Philip Morris International and its former corporate parent. Access the call  at </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmi.com&#47;2022Q1earnings</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 7 style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:1pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:1pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, PMI's total shipment volume increased by 3.5%, driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">the EU, reflecting higher heated tobacco unit shipment volume across the Region (primarily in Germany, Italy and Poland), partly offset by lower cigarette shipment volume (mainly in Germany and Italy, partially offset by Poland and Spain)&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">Middle East &#38; Africa, mainly reflecting higher cigarette shipment volume, primarily in Egypt and PMI Duty Free, partly offset by Algeria&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">South &#38; Southeast Asia, primarily reflecting higher cigarette shipment volume, mainly in Indonesia and the Philippines&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">East Asia &#38; Australia, reflecting higher cigarette and heated tobacco unit shipment volume, primarily in Japan&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">Eastern Europe, reflecting lower cigarette shipment volume, primarily in Russia, partly offset by higher heated tobacco unit shipment volume, mainly in Ukraine and Southeast Europe, partially offset by Russia&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">Americas, primarily reflecting lower cigarette shipment volume, mainly in Argentina, partly offset by Brazil.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 8 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On a pro forma basis, PMI's total shipment volume increased by 4.9%, reflecting an increase of 4.5% in the Eastern Europe Region, as detailed in Appendix 2 and Appendix 3, respectively.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Impact of Inventory Movements</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding the net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements of approximately 1.7 billion units, PMI&#8217;s total in-market sales increased by 2.5%, driven by a 16.7% increase in heated tobacco units and a 0.4% increase in cigarettes.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">The net favorable impact of approximately 1.7 billion units reflected&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:10pt">A net favorable impact of 2.1 billion cigarettes, mainly driven by Japan, PMI Duty Free and Spain&#59; partly offset by</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:10pt">A net unfavorable impact of 0.5 billion heated tobacco units, primarily due to Russia.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On a pro forma basis, PMI's total in-market sales increased by 3.8%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total heated tobacco unit in-market sales volume in the quarter was 24.8 billion units, or 19.5 billion units on a pro forma basis, representing growth of 16.7% and 19.5%, respectively.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">PMI Shipment Volume by Brand</font></div><div style="text-align:center"><table On a pro forma basis, PMI's heated tobacco unit shipment volume increased by 18.4%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">International Share of Market</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's pro forma total international market share (excluding China and the U.S.), defined as PMI's cigarette and heated tobacco unit sales volume as a percentage of total industry cigarette and heated tobacco unit sales volume, increased by 0.7 points to 26.7%, reflecting&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Market share for heated tobacco units of 3.5%, up by 0.6 points&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Market share for cigarettes of 23.3%, up by 0.2 points.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's pro forma total international cigarette sales volume as a percentage of pro forma total industry cigarette sales volume increased by 0.4 points to 24.4%, mainly reflecting higher cigarette market share and&#47;or a favorable geographic mix impact, notably in Indonesia, PMI Duty Free and the Philippines, partly offset by Algeria and Germany.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_34"></div><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Included in Marketing, Administration and Research Costs above.</font></div></td></tr><tr style="height:20pt"><td colspan="42" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Included in Cost of Sales ($26 million) and Marketing, Administration and Research Costs ($16 million) above.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, net revenues increased by 9.0% on an organic basis, mainly reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher heated tobacco unit volume (predominantly in the EU, particularly Germany, Italy and </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 10 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Poland), higher cigarette volume (mainly in Indonesia, PMI Duty Free and the Philippines, partly offset by Germany and Russia) and higher device volume (driven by the EU and Japan), partially offset by unfavorable cigarette mix (mainly in Japan)&#59; and a favorable pricing variance (notably driven by Germany, Russia and Turkey, partly offset by Indonesia and the Philippines).</font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 6% of PMI's total net revenues. Pro forma net revenues increased by 10.0% on an organic basis, as detailed in Schedule 10.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 8.6%, excluding currency and acquisitions, primarily reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher heated tobacco unit volume and higher cigarette volume (each mainly reflecting the same geographies as for net revenues noted above), partly offset by unfavorable cigarette mix (primarily in the EU and Japan) and device mix (predominantly in Japan)&#59; and a favorable pricing variance&#59; partly offset by higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to higher logistics costs and other inflationary impacts, partially offset by productivity).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">On an organic basis, adjusted operating income increased by 8.3%, while adjusted operating income margin decreased by 0.3 points. Pro forma adjusted operating income increased by 9.1%, while pro forma operating income margin decreased by 0.4 points on the same basis, as detailed in Schedule 10. This reflects a lower gross margin compared to a strong prior year margin performance, which benefited from higher productivity mainly due to timing factors.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_43"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, net revenues increased by 10.5% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher heated tobacco unit volume (notably in Germany, Italy and Poland) and higher device volume (notably in Italy), partly offset by lower cigarette volume (mainly in Germany, partly offset by Spain). Pricing variance was slightly favorable, primarily reflecting higher combustible pricing (driven by Germany), largely offset by lower pricing for devices (notably in Italy).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 12.3%, excluding currency and acquisitions, primarily reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher heated tobacco unit volume (primarily reflecting the same geographies as </font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 11 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">for net revenues noted above), partly offset by lower cigarette volume (mainly in Germany)&#59; partially offset by higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 11.7% on an organic basis. Adjusted operating income margin increased by 0.6 points on the same basis.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_52"></div><div style="margin-top:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">0.8</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the quarter, the estimated total market in the EU increased by 3.0% to 109.6 billion units, primarily driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Italy, up by 5.3%, mainly reflecting the impact on adult smoker average daily consumption of the easing of pandemic-related measures&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Poland, up by 18.7%, primarily reflecting a lower estimated prevalence of illicit trade and higher border sales due to the easing of pandemic-related measures&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Germany, down by 7.5%, primarily reflecting the impact of excise tax-driven price increases and higher cross-border (non-domestic) purchases due to the easing of pandemic-related measures.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 4.2% to 45.0 billion units, mainly driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Poland, up by 20.7%, mainly reflecting the higher total market, as well as a higher market share driven by heated tobacco units&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Spain, up by 23.1%, or by 1.7% excluding the net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements, reflecting a higher total market, partly offset by a lower market share due to cigarettes.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding the net unfavorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements (notably in Italy, partly offset by Spain), PMI's total in-market sales volume increased by 5.2%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 12 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_58"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(2.2)pp</font></td><td colspan="3" 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#ffffff;padding:0 1pt"></td></tr><tr style="height:20pt"><td colspan="42" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Included in marketing, administration and research costs at the consolidated operating income level.</font></div></td></tr><tr style="height:20pt"><td colspan="42" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Included in Cost of Sales ($26 million) and Marketing, Administration and Research Costs ($16 million) at the consolidated operating income level</font></div></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, net revenues increased by 0.3% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, mainly driven by higher combustible pricing (primarily in Russia)&#59; largely offset by unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to unfavorable cigarette volume (mainly in Russia). During the quarter, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 65% of PMI's total net revenues in the Region. Pro forma net revenues increased by 11.1% on an organic basis, as detailed in Schedule 10.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income decreased by 21.8%, excluding currency and acquisitions, notably reflecting charges related to the war in Ukraine. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 6.5% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to unfavorable cigarette volume&#47;mix (primarily in Russia)&#59; and higher marketing, administration and research costs&#59; partly offset by a favorable pricing variance.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 2.2 points on an organic basis. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Pro forma adjusted operating income increased by 6.1% on an organic basis, while pro forma adjusted operating income margin decreased by 1.6 points, on the same basis, as detailed in Schedule 10.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_64"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Given the company's intention to exit the Russian market and the impact of the war in Ukraine on business operations in the country, PMI is providing a total market estimate for the Eastern Europe Region excluding Russia and Ukraine.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the quarter, the pro forma estimated total market in Eastern Europe increased, mainly driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Kazakhstan, up by 6.2%, primarily reflecting a favorable comparison versus the prior year period due to the temporary supply chain impact of the introduction, in January 2021, of certain mandatory requirements related to the sale of tobacco products&#59; and</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 13 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Southeast Europe, up by 10.0%, mainly reflecting increased in-bound travel and the impact on adult smoker average daily consumption of the easing of pandemic-related measures.</font></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div 24.4 billion units, primarily due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Russia, down by 9.9%, primarily reflecting a lower total market.</font></div><div style="margin-top:7pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, Russia and Ukraine accounted for around 73% of PMI's total shipment volume in the Region. Pro forma total shipment volume, excluding Russia and Ukraine, increased by 4.5%, as detailed in Appendix 3.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_70"></div><div style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">13.7pp</font></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr style="height:15pt"><td colspan="42" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Included in Marketing, Administration and Research Costs above.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:13pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, net revenues increased by 42.3% on an organic basis, primarily reflecting&#58; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher cigarette volume (primarily in Kuwait and PMI Duty Free, partly offset by Algeria) and higher heated tobacco unit volume (notably in Egypt)&#59; and a favorable pricing variance, driven by combustible pricing (mainly in Turkey).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income increased by 89.9%, excluding currency and acquisitions, mainly reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance&#59; favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by the same factors and geographies as for net revenues noted above&#59; and lower marketing, administration and research costs&#59; partly offset by higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income increased by 88.7% on an organic basis. Adjusted operating income margin increased by 13.7 points on the same basis.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 14 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_76"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the quarter, the estimated total market in the Middle East &#38; Africa decreased, mainly due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Algeria, down by 37.5%, or by 8.2% excluding the net unfavorable impact of estimated trade inventory movements, primarily reflecting industry supply chain disruptions&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Turkey, down by 6.8%, mainly reflecting a higher estimated prevalence of illicit trade, partly offset by the impact on adult smoker average daily consumption of the easing of pandemic-related measures, coupled with increased in-bound tourism&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">International Duty Free, up by 40.2%, reflecting the impact of reduced government travel restrictions and increased passenger traffic in certain geographies.</font></div><div><font><br></font></div><div style="text-align:center"><table style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 8.3% to 30.4 billion units, notably driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">PMI Duty Free, up by +100%, or by 50.8% excluding the net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements, reflecting the higher total market and a higher market share&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">Egypt, up by 10.7%, primarily reflecting a higher market share, driven by cigarettes and heated tobacco units&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:12.25pt">Algeria, down by 27.5%, mainly reflecting the lower total market, partly offset by a higher market share driven by cigarettes.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding the net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements, PMI's total in-market sales volume increased by 4.3%.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div
