style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td><td colspan="2" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">45.4</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">&#160;</font></td><td style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(5.8)pp</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">(5.1)pp</font></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td></tr><tr style="height:20pt"><td colspan="42" style="background-color:#ffffff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Included in marketing, administration and research costs at the consolidated operating income level.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:13pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, net revenues decreased by 0.5% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; an unfavorable pricing variance, due to combustible pricing (mainly in Indonesia and the Philippines)&#59; largely offset by favorable volume&#47;mix, primarily driven by higher cigarette volume (mainly in Indonesia and the Philippines) and favorable cigarette mix (primarily in Indonesia, partly offset by the Philippines).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income decreased by 11.2%, excluding currency and acquisitions, primarily reflecting&#58; an unfavorable pricing variance&#59; partly offset by favorable volume&#47;mix, mainly driven by higher cigarette volume (primarily in Indonesia and the Philippines).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 11.7% on an organic basis. Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 5.1 points on the same basis.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_88"></div><div style="margin-top:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the quarter, the estimated total market in South &#38; Southeast Asia increased, mainly driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">India, up by 7.2%, primarily reflecting a favorable comparison versus the prior year period, during which pandemic-related restrictions impacted the movement of certain products, including tobacco&#59;</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Indonesia, up by 5.8%, mainly reflecting impact on adult smoker consumption of the easing of pandemic-related measures, which drove growth in the tax-advantaged 'below tier one' segment&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the Philippines, up by 19.2%, primarily reflecting the net favorable impact of estimated trade inventory movements related to first-quarter 2022 price increases&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Bangladesh, down by 12.9%, mainly reflecting the impact of pandemic-related restrictions on mobility during February 2022&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Thailand, down by 13.3%, primarily reflecting the impact of excise tax-driven price increases.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 7.5% to 37.6 billion units, mainly driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Indonesia, up by 5.2%, primarily reflecting the higher total market, partly offset by a lower market share (mainly due to adult smoker down-trading to the 'below tier one' segment as a result of significantly lower retail prices, partly offset by share growth for PMI's premium and hand-rolled portfolio)&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">the Philippines, up by 18.4%, primarily reflecting the higher total market.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_94"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">EAST ASIA &#38; AUSTRALIA REGION</font></div><div level.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-top:10pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, net revenues increased by 2.6% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, primarily driven by higher combustible pricing (predominantly in Japan). Volume&#47;mix was slightly favorable, mainly reflecting higher device and heated tobacco unit volume in Japan, largely offset by unfavorable cigarette mix (primarily in Japan) and unfavorable device mix in Japan.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income decreased by 8.1%, excluding currency and acquisitions, mainly reflecting&#58; unfavorable volume&#47;mix, primarily due to unfavorable mix for cigarettes and devices in Japan&#59; and higher manufacturing costs (mainly due to higher logistics costs)&#59; partly offset by lower marketing, administration and research costs (notably driven by a favorable comparison related to 2021 asset impairment and exit costs)&#59; and a favorable pricing variance.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 12.0% on an organic basis. Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 7.0 points on the same basis. The margin decline notably reflects the impact of&#58; higher device sales&#59; the growth of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> within the Region's smoke-free product portfolio mix, with its higher initial unit cost of devices and consumables&#59; and higher logistics costs, including costs related to the use of air freight to Japan to support&#58; (i) the strong up-take of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS ILUMA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">TEREA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> consumables, and (ii) the re-sourcing of select cigarette brands due to the war in Ukraine.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 17 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_100"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the quarter, the estimated total market in East Asia &#38; Australia, excluding China, decreased, mainly due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Japan, down by 3.2%, primarily reflecting the impact of the October 2021 excise tax-driven price increase.</font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:center"><table style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's total shipment volume increased by 1.7% to 20.8 billion units, mainly driven by&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Japan, up by 3.2%. Excluding the net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements, total in-market sales volume was essentially stable.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Excluding the net favorable impact of estimated distributor inventory movements, PMI's total in-market sales volume decreased by 1.0%.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_106"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">AMERICAS REGION</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_109"></div><div style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%"> Included in marketing, administration and research costs at the consolidated operating income level.</font></div></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, net revenues increased by 0.7% on an organic basis, reflecting&#58; a favorable pricing variance, driven by combustible products (mainly in Argentina, Brazil and Mexico)&#59; partly offset by unfavorable volume&#47;mix, mainly due to lower cigarette volume (primarily in Argentina) and unfavorable cigarette mix (primarily in Brazil).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Operating income decreased by 8.2%, excluding currency and acquisitions, mainly reflecting&#58; higher manufacturing costs (primarily due to inflationary impacts)&#59; and unfavorable volume&#47;mix (mainly due to the same factors and geographies as for net revenues noted above)&#59; partly offset by a favorable pricing variance.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Adjusted operating income decreased by 8.9% on an organic basis. Adjusted operating income margin decreased by 3.0 points on the same basis.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 18 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_115"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Total Market, PMI Shipment &#38; Market Share Commentaries</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the quarter, the estimated total market in Americas, excluding the U.S., decreased, primarily due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Canada, down by 14.3%, notably reflecting the impact of price increases and out-switching from cigarettes to e-vapor products&#59; and</font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Mexico, down by 3.8%. Excluding the net unfavorable impact of estimated trade inventory movements, the total market increased by 1.4%, mainly driven by the impact on adult smoker average daily consumption of the easing of pandemic-related measures, coupled with the impact of increased in-bound tourism&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Brazil, up by 4.1%, primarily reflecting a lower estimated prevalence of illicit trade.</font></div><div style="margin-top:18pt;text-align:center"><table 14.9 billion units, mainly due to&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;padding-left:14.5pt">Argentina, down by 7.1%, primarily reflecting a lower market share due to adult smoker down-trading to ultra-low-price brands produced by local manufacturers&#59;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">partly offset by</font></div><div market share driven by </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Chesterfield</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_124"></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">OTHER</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In the third quarter of 2021, PMI acquired Fertin Pharma A&#47;S, Vectura Group plc. and OtiTopic, Inc. On March 31, 2022, PMI launched a new Wellness and Healthcare business consolidating these entities, Vectura Fertin Pharma. The operating results of this new business are reported in the Other category. The business operations of PMI's Wellness and Healthcare business are managed and evaluated separately from the geographical segments.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:center"><table style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">%</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">&#8212;pp</font></td><td colspan="3" style="background-color:#cceeff;padding:2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:middle"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">&#8212;pp</font></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 style="display:none"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 19 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:40.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">During the quarter, PMI recorded net revenues of $66 million, as well as an operating loss of $31 million, primarily reflecting the amortization of intangibles related to the acquisitions, investments in research and development, and expenses related to employee retention programs.</font></div><div style="height:40.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 20 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_127"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Philip Morris International&#58; Delivering a Smoke-Free Future</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">Philip Morris International (PMI) is a leading international tobacco company working to deliver a smoke-free future and evolving its portfolio for the long-term to include products outside of the tobacco and nicotine sector. The company&#8217;s current product portfolio primarily consists of cigarettes and smoke-free products, including heat-not-burn, vapor and oral nicotine products, which are sold in markets outside the U.S. Since 2008, PMI has invested more than USD 9 billion to develop, scientifically substantiate and commercialize innovative smoke-free products for adults who would otherwise continue to smoke, with the goal of completely ending the sale of cigarettes. This includes the building of world-class scientific assessment capabilities, notably in the areas of pre-clinical systems toxicology, clinical and behavioral research, as well as post-market studies. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has authorized the marketing of versions of PMI&#8217;s </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> Platform 1 devices and consumables as Modified Risk Tobacco Products (MRTPs), finding that exposure modification orders for these products are appropriate to promote the public health. As of March&#160;31, 2022, PMI's smoke-free products were available for sale in 71 markets, and PMI estimates that approximately 12.7 million adults around the world, excluding Russia and Ukraine, had already switched to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> and stopped smoking. With a strong foundation and significant expertise in life-sciences, in February 2021 PMI announced its ambition to expand into wellness and healthcare areas and deliver innovative products and solutions that aim to address unmet consumer and patient needs. For more information, please visit </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmi.com</font><font style="color:#0563c1;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> </font><font style="color:#333333;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%;text-decoration:underline">www.pmiscience.com</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_130"></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Forward-Looking and Cautionary Statements</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">This press release contains projections of future results and other forward-looking statements. Achievement of future results is subject to risks, uncertainties and inaccurate assumptions. In the event that risks or uncertainties materialize, or underlying assumptions prove inaccurate, actual results could vary materially from those contained in such forward-looking statements. Pursuant to the &#8220;safe harbor&#8221; provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995, PMI is identifying important factors that, individually or in the aggregate, could cause actual results and outcomes to differ materially from those contained in any forward-looking statements made by PMI.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI's business risks include&#58; excise tax increases and discriminatory tax structures&#59; increasing marketing and regulatory restrictions that could reduce our competitiveness, eliminate our ability to communicate with adult consumers, or ban certain of our products in certain markets or countries&#59; health concerns relating to the use of tobacco and other nicotine-containing products and exposure to environmental tobacco smoke&#59; litigation related to tobacco use and intellectual property&#59; intense competition&#59; the effects of global and individual country economic, regulatory and political developments, natural disasters and conflicts&#59; the impact and consequences of Russia's invasion of Ukraine&#59; changes in adult smoker behavior&#59; lost revenues as a result of counterfeiting, contraband and cross-border purchases&#59; governmental investigations&#59; unfavorable currency exchange rates and currency devaluations, and limitations on the ability to repatriate funds&#59; adverse changes in applicable corporate tax laws&#59; adverse changes in the cost, availability, and quality of tobacco and other agricultural products and raw materials, as well as components and materials for our electronic devices&#59; and the integrity of its information systems and effectiveness of its data privacy policies. PMI's future profitability may also be adversely affected should it be unsuccessful in its attempts to produce and commercialize reduced-risk products or if regulation or taxation do not differentiate between such products and cigarettes&#59; if it is unable to successfully introduce new products, promote brand equity, enter new markets or improve its margins through increased prices and productivity gains&#59; if it is unable to expand its brand portfolio internally or through acquisitions and the development of strategic business relationships&#59; or if it is unable to attract and retain the best global talent, </font></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 21 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">including women or diverse candidates. Future results are also subject to the lower predictability of our reduced-risk product category's performance.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">In addition, PMI&#8217;s business risks also include risks and uncertainties related to PMI&#8217;s acquisitions of Fertin Pharma A&#47;S (&#8220;Fertin&#8221;), OtiTopic, Inc. (&#34;OtiTopic&#34;) and Vectura Group plc (&#8220;Vectura&#8221;), including, amongst other things&#58; (1) the possibility that the integration of the operations of Fertin and Vectura with those of PMI may be more difficult and&#47;or take longer than anticipated, and may not accelerate PMI&#8217;s desired entry into additional smoke-free and beyond nicotine platforms as quickly as anticipated&#59; (2) the possibility that the respective integrations of Fertin and Vectura into PMI may be more costly than anticipated and may have unanticipated adverse results relating to Fertin, Vectura or PMI&#8217;s existing businesses&#59; (3) the inability to gain access to or acquire differentiated proprietary assets, technology and&#47;or pharmaceutical development expertise as anticipated by these acquisitions&#59; (4) risks associated with third-party contracts containing consent and&#47;or other contractual provisions that may be triggered by the acquisitions&#59; (5) the success of the research and development efforts of Fertin, OtiTopic and Vectura, including the ability to obtain regulatory approval for new products, and the ability to commercialize or license these new products&#59; (6) any unanticipated safety, quality or efficacy concerns and the impact of identified concerns associated with the products developed by Fertin, OtiTopic and Vectura&#59; and (7) the ability of PMI to retain key personnel of Fertin and Vectura, or hire key talent to work in the Fertin and Vectura businesses due to their affiliation with PMI.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:8pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">PMI is further subject to other risks detailed from time to time in its publicly filed documents, including PMI's Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fourth quarter and year ended December 31, 2021 and the Form 10-Q for the quarter ended March&#160;31, 2022, which will be filed in the coming days. PMI cautions that the foregoing list of important factors is not a complete discussion of all potential risks and uncertainties. PMI does not undertake to update any forward-looking statement that it may make from time to time, except in the normal course of its public disclosure obligations.</font></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_133"></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Key Terms, Definitions and Explanatory Notes</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">General</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:174%"> </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;PMI&#34; refers to Philip Morris International Inc. and its subsidiaries. Trademarks and service marks that are the registered property of, or licensed by, the subsidiaries of PMI, are italicized.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Comparisons are made to the same prior-year period unless otherwise stated.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">References to total industry, total market, PMI shipment volume and PMI market share performance reflect cigarettes and heated tobacco units, unless otherwise stated.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">As of the first quarter of 2022, total industry volume, PMI in-market sales volume and PMI market share for the following geographies include the cigarillo category in Japan&#58; the total international market, East Asia &#38; Australia Region, and Japanese domestic market.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">References to total international market, defined as worldwide cigarette and heated tobacco unit volume excluding the U.S., total industry, total market and market shares are PMI estimates for tax-paid products based on the latest available data from a number of internal and external sources and may, in defined instances, exclude the People's Republic of China and&#47;or PMI's duty free business.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">2021 and 2022 estimates for total industry volume and market share in certain geographies reflect limitations on the availability and accuracy of industry data during pandemic-related restrictions.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">First-quarter 2022 estimates for total industry volume and market share in the Philippines reflect limitations on the availability and accuracy of industry data.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Combustible products&#34; is the term PMI uses to refer to cigarettes and OTP, combined.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#181717;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">In-market sales, or &#34;IMS,&#34; is defined as sales to the retail channel, depending on the market and distribution model.</font></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 22 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Total shipment volume&#34; is defined as the combined total of cigarette shipment volume and heated tobacco unit shipment volume.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Americas&#34; refers to the former Latin America &#38; Canada segment, which was renamed as the Americas segment as of the third quarter of 2021. References to &#34;Americas&#34; may, in defined instances, exclude the U.S.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;North Africa&#34; is defined as Algeria, Egypt, Libya, Morocco and Tunisia.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;The GCC&#34; (Gulf Cooperation Council) is defined as Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates (UAE).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Southeast Europe&#34; is defined as Albania, Bosnia &#38; Herzegovina, Kosovo, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Serbia.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">In the third quarter of 2021, PMI acquired Fertin Pharma A&#47;S, Vectura Group plc. and OtiTopic, Inc. On March 31, 2022, PMI launched a new Wellness and Healthcare business consolidating these entities, Vectura Fertin Pharma. The operating results of this new business are reported in the Other category. The business operations of PMI's Wellness and Healthcare business are managed and evaluated separately from the geographical segments.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Following the deconsolidation of PMI's Canadian subsidiary, Rothmans, Benson &#38; Hedges, Inc. (RBH) on March 22, 2019, PMI continues to report the volume of brands sold by RBH for which other PMI subsidiaries are the trademark owner. These include </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HEETS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Next</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Philip Morris</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Rooftop</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">From time to time, PMI&#8217;s shipment volumes are subject to the impact of distributor inventory movements, and estimated total industry&#47;market volumes are subject to the impact of inventory movements in various trade channels that include estimated trade inventory movements of PMI&#8217;s competitors arising from market-specific factors that significantly distort reported volume disclosures. Such factors may include changes to the manufacturing supply chain, shipment methods, consumer demand, timing of excise tax increases or other influences that may affect the timing of sales to customers. In such instances, in addition to reviewing PMI shipment volumes and certain estimated total industry&#47;market volumes on a reported basis, management reviews these measures on an adjusted basis that excludes the impact of distributor and&#47;or estimated trade inventory movements. Management also believes that disclosing PMI shipment volumes and estimated total industry&#47;market volumes in such circumstances on a basis that excludes the impact of distributor and&#47;or estimated trade inventory movements, such as on an IMS basis, improves the comparability of performance and trends for these measures over different reporting periods.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Financial</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Net revenues related to combustible products refer to the operating revenues generated from the sale of these products, including shipping and handling charges billed to customers, net of sales and promotion incentives, and excise taxes. PMI recognizes revenue when control is transferred to the customer, typically either upon shipment or delivery of goods.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Net revenues related to RRPs represent the sale of heated tobacco units, heat-not-burn devices and related accessories, and other nicotine-containing products, primarily e-vapor and oral nicotine products, including shipping and handling charges billed to customers, net of sales and promotion incentives, and excise taxes.</font><font style="color:#ff0000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">PMI recognizes revenue when control is transferred to the customer, typically either upon shipment or delivery of goods.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Net revenues in the Other category primarily consist of operating revenues generated from the sale of inhaled therapeutics and oral and intra-oral delivery systems that are included in the operating results of PMI's new Wellness and Healthcare business, Vectura Fertin Pharma. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Adjusted net revenues exclude the impact related to the Saudi Arabia customs assessments. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Cost of sales&#34; consists principally of&#58; tobacco leaf, non-tobacco raw materials, labor and manufacturing costs&#59; shipping and handling costs&#59; and the cost of devices produced by third-party electronics manufacturing service providers.&#160;Estimated costs associated with device warranty programs are generally provided for in cost of sales in the period the related revenues are recognized.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Marketing, administration and research costs&#34; include the costs of marketing and selling our products, other costs generally not related to the manufacture of our products (including general corporate expenses), and costs incurred to develop new products. The most significant components of our marketing, administration and research costs are marketing and sales expenses and general and administrative expenses. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Cost&#47;Other&#34; in the Consolidated Financial Summary table of total PMI and the six geographical segments of this release reflects the currency-neutral variances of&#58; cost of sales (excluding the volume&#47;mix cost </font></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 23 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">component)&#59; marketing, administration and research costs (including asset impairment and exit costs)&#59; and amortization of intangibles. &#8220;Cost&#47;Other&#8221; also includes the currency-neutral net revenue variance, unrelated to volume&#47;mix and price components, attributable to&#58; fees for certain distribution rights billed to customers in certain markets in the ME&#38;A Region and the Saudi Arabia customs assessment net revenue adjustment.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Adjusted Operating Income Margin&#34; is calculated as adjusted operating income, divided by adjusted net revenues.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Adjusted EBITDA&#34; is defined as earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, amortization and equity (income)&#47;loss in unconsolidated subsidiaries, excluding asset impairment and exit costs, and unusual items.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Net debt&#34; is defined as total debt, less cash and cash equivalents.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Figures and comparisons presented on a pro forma basis exclude PMI&#8217;s operations in Russia and Ukraine.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Growth rates presented on an organic basis reflect currency-neutral adjusted results, excluding acquisitions.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Management reviews net revenues, operating income, operating income margin, operating cash flow and earnings per share, or &#34;EPS,&#34; on an adjusted basis, which may exclude the impact of currency and other items such as acquisitions, asset impairment and exit costs, tax items and other special items. Currency-neutral and organic growth rates reflect the way management views underlying performance for these measures. PMI believes that such measures provide useful insight into underlying business trends and results. Management reviews these measures because they exclude changes in currency exchange rates and other factors that may distort underlying business trends, thereby improving the comparability of PMI&#8217;s business performance between reporting periods. Furthermore, PMI uses several of these measures in its management compensation program to promote internal fairness and a disciplined assessment of performance against company targets. PMI discloses these measures to enable investors to view the business through the eyes of management.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Non-GAAP measures used in this release should neither be considered in isolation nor as a substitute for the financial measures prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP. For a reconciliation of non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable U.S. GAAP measures, see the relevant schedules provided with this press release.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">U.S. GAAP Treatment of a country as a Highly Inflationary Economy. Following the categorization of a country by the International Practices Task Force of the Center for Audit Quality as having a three-year cumulative inflation rate greater than 100%, the country is considered highly inflationary in accordance with U.S. GAAP. For such countries, PMI accounts for the operations of its local affiliates as highly inflationary, and to treat the U.S. dollar as the functional currency of the affiliates. Such treatment was effective July 1, 2018, for Argentina, and April 1, 2022, for Turkey.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Fair value adjustment for equity security investments&#34; reflects the adjustment resulting from share price movements in passive investments for publicly traded entities that are not controlled or influenced by PMI. Under U.S. GAAP, such adjustments are required, since January 1, 2018, to be reflected directly in the income statement.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:174%">Reduced-Risk Products</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Reduced-risk products (&#8220;RRPs&#8221;) is the term PMI uses to refer to products that present, are likely to present, or have the potential to present less risk of harm to smokers who switch to these products versus continuing smoking.&#160;PMI has a range of RRPs in various stages of development, scientific assessment and commercialization. PMI's RRPs are smoke-free products that contain and&#47;or generate far lower quantities of harmful and potentially harmful constituents than found in cigarette smoke.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;Heated tobacco units,&#34; or &#34;HTUs,&#34; is the term PMI uses to refer to heated tobacco consumables, which include the company's </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HEETS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HEETS Creations</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HEETS Dimensions</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HEETS Marlboro </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HEETS FROM MARLBORO</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> (defined collectively as </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HEETS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">), </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Marlboro</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Dimensions</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Marlboro</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">HeatSticks,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Parliament HeatSticks</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">TEREA</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, as well as the KT&#38;G-licensed brands, </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Fiit</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Miix </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">(outside of South Korea).</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Market share for HTUs is defined as the total sales volume for HTUs as a percentage of the total estimated sales volume for cigarettes and HTUs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">Unless otherwise stated, all references to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> are to PMI's Platform 1 </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> devices and heated tobacco consumables.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> heat-not-burn devices are precisely controlled heating devices into which a specially designed and proprietary tobacco units are inserted and heated to generate an aerosol.</font></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 24 -</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:45pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;PMI heat-not-burn products&#34; include licensed KT&#38;G heat-not-burn products.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#34;PMI HTUs&#34; include licensed KT&#38;G HTUs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">&#8220;Total </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> users&#8221; is defined as the estimated number of Legal Age (minimum 18 years) users of PMI heat-not-burn products, for which PMI HTUs represented at least a portion of their daily tobacco consumption over the past seven days.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The estimated number of adults who have &#34;switched to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and stopped smoking&#34; reflects&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">for markets where there are no heat-not-burn products other than PMI heat-not-burn products&#58; daily individual consumption of PMI HTUs represents the totality of their daily tobacco consumption in the past seven days&#59; </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-15.75pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.25pt">for markets where PMI heat-not-burn products are among other heat-not-burn products&#58; daily individual consumption of HTUs represents the totality of their daily tobacco consumption in the past seven days, of which at least 70% is PMI HTUs.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Note&#58; The above </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> user metrics reflect PMI estimates, which are based on consumer claims and sample-based statistical assessments with an average margin of error of +&#47;-5% at a 95% Confidence Interval in key volume markets. The accuracy and reliability of </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">IQOS</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> user metrics may vary based on individual market maturity and availability of information.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">As of December 2020, PMI heat-not-burn products and HTUs include licensed KT&#38;G heat-not-burn products and HTUs, respectively.</font></div><div style="height:45pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Arial',sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:400;line-height:174%">- 25 -</font></div></div></div><div id="ic05a0e86707d420aa352063f60714dd4_136"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div><font><br></font></div></div><div <td>na</td>

<table border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" class="authRefData" style="display: none;" id="defref_dei_WrittenCommunications">
<tr><td class="hide"><a style="color: white;" href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.hideAR();">X</a></td></tr>
<tr><td><div class="body" style="padding: 2px;">
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">- Definition</a><div><p>Boolean flag that is true when the Form 8-K filing is intended to satisfy the filing obligation of the registrant as written communications pursuant to Rule 425 under the Securities Act.</p></div>
<a href="javascript:void(0);" onclick="top.Show.toggleNext( this );">+ References</a><div style="display: none;"><p>Reference 1: http://www.xbrl.org/2003/role/presentationRef<br> -Publisher SEC<br> -Name Securities Act<br> -Number 230<br> -Section 425<br></p></div>

<FILENAME>Show.js
<DESCRIPTION>IDEA: XBRL DOCUMENT
<TEXT>
// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */
..report table.authRefData{
	background-color: #def;
	border: 2px solid #2F4497;
	font-size: 1em;
	position: absolute;
}

..report table.authRefData a {
	display: block;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report table.authRefData p {
	margin-top: 0px;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide {
	background-color: #2F4497;
	padding: 1px 3px 0px 0px;
	text-align: right;
}

..report table.authRefData .hide a:hover {
	background-color: #2F4497;
}

..report table.authRefData .body {
	height: 150px;
	overflow: auto;
	width: 400px;
}

..report table.authRefData table{
	font-size: 1em;
}

/* Report Styles */
..pl a, .pl a:visited {
	color: black;
	text-decoration: none;
}

/* table */
..report {
	background-color: white;
	border: 2px solid #acf;
	clear: both;
	color: black;
	font: normal 8pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	margin-bottom: 2em;
}

..report hr {
	border: 1px solid #acf;
}

/* Top labels */
..report th {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
	text-align: center;
}

..report th.void	{
	background-color: transparent;
	color: #000000;
	font: bold 10pt Helvetica, Arial, san-serif;
	text-align: left;
}

..report .pl {
	text-align: left;
	vertical-align: top;
	white-space: normal;
	width: 200px;
	white-space: normal; /* word-wrap: break-word; */
}

..report td.pl a.a {
	cursor: pointer;
	display: block;
	width: 200px;
	overflow: hidden;
}

..report td.pl div.a {
	width: 200px;
}

..report td.pl a:hover {
	background-color: #ffc;
}

/* Header rows... */
..report tr.rh {
	background-color: #acf;
	color: black;
	font-weight: bold;
}

/* Calendars... */
..report .rc {
	background-color: #f0f0f0;
}

/* Even rows... */
..report .re, .report .reu {
	background-color: #def;
}

..report .reu td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

/* Odd rows... */
..report .ro, .report .rou {
	background-color: white;
}

..report .rou td {
	border-bottom: 1px solid black;
}

..report .rou table td, .report .reu table td {
	border-bottom: 0px solid black;
}

/* styles for footnote marker */
..report .fn {
	white-space: nowrap;
}

/* styles for numeric types */
..report .num, .report .nump {
	text-align: right;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

..report .nump {
	padding-left: 2em;
}

..report .nump {
	padding: 0px 0.4em 0px 2em;
}

/* styles for text types */
..report .text {
	text-align: left;
	white-space: normal;
}

..report .text .big {
	margin-bottom: 1em;
	width: 17em;
}

..report .text .more {
	display: none;
}

..report .text .note {
	font-style: italic;
	font-weight: bold;
}

..report .text .small {
	width: 10em;
}

..report sup {
	font-style: italic;
}

..report .outerFootnotes {
	font-size: 1em;
}
